newsitem.title: BULGARIA: BULGARIAN UNEMPLOYMENT STEADY AT 10.4 PCT IN AUGUST.
newsitem.headline: BULGARIAN UNEMPLOYMENT STEADY AT 10.4 PCT IN AUGUST.

text.p: The number of people unemployed
in Bulgaria in August was steady at 396,155 or 10.4 percent of
the workforce against 396,381 in July, the National Labour
Exchange (NLE) said.
BULGARIAN UNEMPLOYMENT AUGUST JULY AUGUST'95
pct of workforce 10.4 10.4 10.7
"Jobless rate was practically unchanged as new university
graduates continued to register on the labour market but more
labour vacancies in farming and construction industry were
filled," NLE chairman Milcho Dimitrov told reportes.
However, the number of jobless in Bulgaria is expected to
rise by the end of the year due to the planned closures of
loss-making state enterprises, Dimitrov added.
The socialist government, in a bid to win cruicial finding
from international lending institutions, has pledged to close
down 64 debt-ridden state firms, where up to 40,000 people were
employed.
"Latest figures show that some 7,600 people have lost their
jobs due to the liquidation of state firms so far," Dimitrov
said.
He added that the number of people expected to seek jobs on
the labour market by the year-end depended on the options that
would be chosen for some of the firms on the closure list.
Some state companies initially slated for liquidation, such
as the country's second largest oil refinery Plama, were taken
off the list and were privatised.
Cash-strapped Bulgaria is expected to speed up liquidation
of loss-makers after the International Monetary Fund postponed
a second tranche of a loan earlier this month until the
socialist cabinet completes the closures, analysts said.
-- Sofia Newsroom, 359-2-84561
